result.execSummary:
The defendant Erika M Darga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: SENTENCING Transcript commencing JUNE 2, 2017 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 16CF447 (18 Pages).

Defendant Erika M Darga in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Erika M Darga in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  MICHAEL A.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWO HUNDRED SEVENTEEN (217) DAYS time served.  CONCURRENT TO 16CF447.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept WHILE ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION ON 16447.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Erika M Darga in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Erika M Darga in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Erika M Darga in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

On Motion of the State,  COURT VACATED THE GUILTY PLEA FOR THE CHARGE CONTRARY TO WIS. STATS. 948.03(2)(b).  On Motion of the State,  Court ordered count 1 AMENDED to Battery,  contrary to Wis. Stats 940.19(1),  a Class A Misdemeanor.
Filed, sdg.  Review hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
